Package net.xuset.objectIO.netObj

A NetObject is used for converting a MarkupMsg object into something meaningful.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    NetFuncListener
    This class is what is used to simulate the function calls of NetFunc.
    NetObject
    This class outlines the functions necessary for synchronizing data across connections.
    NetVarListener<T>
    Used in conjunction with NetVar to notify a variable change.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractNetObject
    Helper class so implementations will not have to define a trivial getId() method every time.
    ArrayNetClass
    NetClass implementation that uses an ArrayList as a back-end.
    DummyNetClass
    A NetClass implementation that does not store anything.
    HashNetClass
    NetClass implementation that uses a HashMap as a back-end.
    NetClass
    NetClass is used to store and organize NetObject instances.
    NetFunc
    NetFunc allows functionality to be serialized and deserialized.
    NetVar<T>
    NetObject implementation that stores a given variable.
    NetVar.nBool
    Stores the value of an Boolean.
    NetVar.nDouble
    Stores the value of an Double.
    NetVar.nFloat
    Stores the value of an Float.
    NetVar.nInt
    Stores the value of an Integer.
    NetVar.nLong
    Stores the value of an Long.
    NetVar.nString
    Stores the value of an String.

Package net.xuset.objectIO.netObj Description

A NetObject is used for converting a MarkupMsg object into something meaningful. Objects that inherit the NetObject interface provide means for serializing itself into a MarkupMsg object and then deserializing a message.

The NetVar class stores a variable. When the variable changes, an update MarkupMsg message can be created then sent to other Connection instances so those connections can know what the new value is.
